text: Adrian C. Wilcox High School is a public high school in Santa Clara, California, United States. It is for students in grades nine through twelve. It is one of four high schools in the Santa Clara Unified School District (SCUSD). In April 2005, Wilcox became a California Distinguished School. Wilcox High School opened in 1961. It is named after Adrian Clyde Wilcox, a member of the Santa Clara Union High School District Board of Trustees. In 1981, Wilcox's colors, mascot, newspaper name, and yearbook name were changed. == Student life == As of the 2024–2025 school year, Wilcox High School has 24 Advanced Placement (AP) classes. It also has a lot of clubs, sports, and activities. For example, there is a robotics team, an orchestra, a cheerleading team, and a theatre company. Each grade has a class color. The class colors are usually used on spirit days. As of the 2024–2025 school year, the class colors are: Class of Standing Color 2028 Freshman Green 2027 Sophomore Blue 2026 Junior Red 2025 Senior Yellow == References == Category:Schools in California Category:High schools in the United States Category:Santa Clara, California
title: Adrian C. Wilcox High School
